summary: This document is a formal revocation and termination of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One' executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein in October 2012. It details the history of the trust's creation and amendments, and directs the trustees to return all assets to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator and grantor of the trust who is revoking and terminating it, directing all assets be returned to him.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named as a trustee in the amended trust agreement and a current trustee at the time of revocation.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Named as a trustee in the amended trust agreement and a current trustee at the time of revocation.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: Was an original trustee of the trust when it was created in 2001.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Was named as a trustee in the 2012 amended agreement but never executed it, and thus was not a trustee at the time of revocation.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: The notary public who acknowledged Jeffrey E. Epstein's signature on the revocation document in October 2012.

connections.description: Epstein, as grantor, is directing trustee Indyke to terminate the trust and return assets.
Epstein, as grantor, is directing trustee Farkas to terminate the trust and return assets.
Both served as co-trustees of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.
Epstein and Schantz were co-trustees under the original 2001 trust agreement.

events.title: Creation of Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein entered into a trust agreement, creating The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One, with himself and Jeffrey A. Schantz as trustees.

events.title: First Amendment and Restatement of Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein amended and restated the original trust agreement, naming Darren K. Indyke, Jes Staley, and Andrew Farkas as the new trustees.

events.title: Revocation and Termination of Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed a formal instrument revoking and terminating The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One, directing all assets be returned to him.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein revoked and terminated his '2001 Trust One' in October 2012, directing all assets be returned directly to him.

The trust had been amended in January 2012 to name Darren K. Indyke, Jes Staley, and Andrew Farkas as trustees, but only Indyke and Farkas had executed the agreement and were serving as trustees at revocation.
Epstein, as grantor, reserved the right to unilaterally revoke the trust, which he exercised by delivering a written instrument to the trustees.
The document was notarized by Harry I. Beller, a Notary Public for the State of New York, in October 2012.
